Package org.cloudsimplus.traces.azure

Class TracesBatchesManager

java.lang.Object
org.cloudsimplus.traces.azure.TracesBatchesManager
public class TracesBatchesManager extends Object
A class for handling the dynamic submission of VM requests to the DatacenterBroker. The user can define a batch size and the requests are dynamically submitted in groups of that size. A batch size of 1 means that the requests are submitted one by one. A batch size of 100 means that the requests are submitted in groups of 100. This solution has been implemented because the simulator becomes slow if a big number of requests is submitted at the beginning of the simulation. In contrast, the simulator becomes significantly faster if smaller batches are submitted dynamically. This is probably related to the way the requests are handled by the DatacenterBroker. TODO: This has not been investigated further and wore work is needed to assess if a similar solution would be beneficial at the broker level.
Since:
CloudSim Plus 7.3.2
Author:
Pavlos Maniotis

  • Constructor Details

    • TracesBatchesManager

      public TracesBatchesManager(TracesSimulationManager simulationManager)
      Constructor to initialize the TracesSimulationManager and to add the necessary listeners for the simulation events. The TracesBatchesManager monitors the events in order to now when to submit the request batches.

  • Method Details

    • createRequestBatches

      private List<List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm>> createRequestBatches()
      Creates and returns a List with the request batches from the dataset

    • createRequestsFromRecords

      private List<org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm> createRequestsFromRecords()
      Creates a List of requests from the dataset

    • createRequest

      private org.cloudbus.cloudsim.vms.Vm createRequest(List<VmRecord> record)
      Takes as input a trace record in the form of List and creates a request. If the list contains one record it creates a single Vm request, while it creates a VmPlacementGroup in case it contains more than one records.

    • submitNextBatch

      private void submitNextBatch(org.cloudsimplus.listeners.EventInfo info)
      Submits the next batch of VM requests to the DatacenterBroker. It also schedules the next batch submission in case there are additional batches. The event to schedule the next submission is marked with a CloudSimTag.BATCH_TAG.

    • printSimulationProgress

      private void printSimulationProgress()
      Prints the simulation progress based on the number of submitted batches.

    • vmAllocationListener

      private void vmAllocationListener(org.cloudsimplus.listeners.VmEventInfo info)
      A listener to be called everytime a request is placed in the data center. Check createRequest(List) to see how it is allocated to the requests. A Cloudlet is created for every request to simulate the VM lifetimes.

    • cloudletFinishListener

      private void cloudletFinishListener(org.cloudsimplus.listeners.CloudletVmEventInfo info)
      A listener to be called everytime a Cloudlet finishes its execution. The VMs of the request associated with the Cloudlet are destroyed when the listener is executed.

    • simulationStartListener

      public void simulationStartListener(org.cloudsimplus.listeners.EventInfo info)
      A listener to be called at the beginning of the simulation. It calculates any potential startup lag and submits the first batch with the VM requests to the DatacenterBroker.

    • simulationEventListener

      private void simulationEventListener(org.cloudsimplus.listeners.EventInfo info)
      A listener to check the simulation events in order to identify when it's time to submit the next batch of VM requests to the DatacenterBroker. These events are marked with a CloudSimTag.BATCH_TAG.

    • getParser

      public TracesParser getParser()
      Returns the TracesParser of the dataset

    • getStatisticsManager

      public TracesStatisticsManager getStatisticsManager()
      Returns the TracesStatisticsManager
